Datatable.LocalizationPair: VAULTERS
An ancient, nomadic people that have had a galactic run of bad luck, Vaulters are humanoids who are skilled in science and defensive warfare.
An ancient, nomadic people that have had a galactic run of bad luck, Vaulters are humanoids who are skilled in science and defensive warfare.

Home Planet Type: Terran Diplomatic Alignment: Neutral Gameplay: Defense, Science Main Victory Type: Scientific
An ancient faction, the Vaulters have suffered a number of major setbacks in trying to establish a permanent home for themselves. Though characterized as restless wanderers, they are in fact a proud and adaptable race, seeking a system that they can finally call 'home.' Their centuries of travel and tinkering have made them skilled at both science and warfare, though their greatest military strength is in defense.
The Vaulters have an old tradition of appointing female leaders, and their trust in this tradition has been confirmed by the faction's uncanny ability to escape, survive, and live to fight another day. Once based on the planet Auriga, they left the planet when their predictions indicated potentially cataclysmic geo-atmospheric problems. Their attempts to colonize elsewhere have only had brief success, and the notion of a permanent base has gained an almost mythical status.
FACTION TRAIT
Kitchen Chemists
A nation of tinkers and hobbyists, scientific experimentation is done everywhere and all the time. Scorched eyebrows and billows of smoke are common sights.
Vaulter Affinity
Provides a basic set of faction traits similar to the Vaulters (Science/Defence, Fleet teleportation)
ONCE CONSTRUCTED, THE PORTAL CONSUMES ALL REMAINING MOVEMENT POINTS WHEN USED.
REQUIRES AT LEAST ONE MOVEMENT POINT.
Vaulters Appearance
Your custom faction will display the 2D and 3D visuals of the Vaulters.
ADVANCED APERTURES
The use of the system portals consumes 75% of Ḡ instead of all remaining Ḡ. At least one movement point is still required.
EXTENDED BUNKERS

Part of the diplomatic deal with allied nations is the local installation of Vaulter mini-bunkers. Ostensibly for defense and supply, in reality they are miniature "pocket" portals running real-time galaxy-wide data exchanges. Communicating via these bunkers gives a major information advantage to Vaulter fleets in allied territory.
ALLIED C3 SYSTEMS

Using the latest advances in military technology, Vaulters integrate their own battlefield communications systems with those of allied factions. The result gives them a major bonus when planning offensive or defensive operations.
EFFICIENT SHIELDING

By augmenting the natural magnetic characteristics of the hull material and using lighter alloys in construction, this improved ship design gives bonuses to tonnage and improves kinetic and missile defense.
BARYONIC SHIELDING
While there are some particles that can pass through plasma shielding, this improved version prevents penetration by any baryon particle (primarily neutrons and protons).
APPLIED ATMOSPHERICS

A great deal of practical engineering for ships can be learned from atmospheric sciences. In particular, streamlined and efficient ventilation systems as well as more advanced magnetic and thermodynamic models all aid in creating next-generation ships
NON-BARYONIC SHIELDING

Non-baryonic particles had long been the great mystery of advanced physics. Now, a greater understanding of the nature and mechanics of particles such as photons, gravitons, and anti-matter permits the creation of shielding systems that either repel or contain non-baryonic matter.
DEFCON INCUBATORS

These are specialized incubators for Vaulter entrepreneurs who want to create defense-oriented technology start-ups. The companies receive privileged access to the latest scientific research, and in turn generate both improved technologies and better gear for allied units.
MILITARY-ARTISANAL COMPLEX

A new theory in the development of complex societies, it turns much manufacturing theory on its head. Essentially, the use of highly coupled, massively on-line individual machine shops permits highly efficient local industry while maintaining the benefits of large-scale, standardized products.
NEURO-COUPLED DATA

One of the things discovered as a branch development of the Vaulter portal technology is the ability to directly 'feed' data into complex electrical networks -- including the brain. While extended sessions can be exhausting or even life-threatening, it provides an efficient way to rapidly disseminate large amounts of information to many learners.
STEALTH SATELLITES

Extending their technology to autonomous semi-permanent portals, Vaulter scientists have created satellites that share vast volumes of data instantaneously across great distances. They power up and down in micro-seconds, thus maintaining near-zero levels of radiation.
"POCKET" PORTAL TECH

Used to doing more with less, Vaulter scientists have devised miniaturized portal systems. Rather than transferring objects, they act as an instantaneous communication web that keeps Vaulter fleets across the galaxy in touch with each other.
NATURAL APERTURES

The discovery of naturaly-occurring weak points in the fabric of time-space has allowed a great leap in the use of portal transport. By building or re-aligning portals according to locations where objects more easily slip between dimensions, the energy cost of portal travel is greatly reduced.
SUB-QUANTUM CALORIMETERS

An inevitable advance from traditional, semi-conductor based particle detection, these new "Advanced Nosfer" systems capture data from a wide range of inputs - quantum perturbations, dark matter interactions, and time-reversed polarity inflected anti-matter.
Nadjne
Role: Colonization
Anjka
Role: Exploration/Multiple Generally an explorer-class ship, named for a famed Vaulter explorer who discovered their previous home planet, Orrin.
Ylona
Role: Multiple A ship that has an advantage when loading weapon modules, it is named for the warrior leader who coined the Vaulter phrase "Glory benefits one; survival, all."
Ljdya

Role: Multiple Designed for large engines and heavy armor, this class of Vaulter ship is named for the leader who maintained the defensive capabilities of four vulnerable spatial platforms during the War of the Broken Skies.
Erszebet

Role: Defense/Multiple Reliable, dependable, and oriented towards defense, this ship class is an all-round performer. It is named after a Vaulter hero who perished leading the rearguard when the Vaulter clans were driven from Orrin .
Yldjko

Role: Multiple Large, heavy, and dangerous, this class of ship is nicknamed for the famous "Rock of the Eyrie." While stories of her exploits on Auriga are legendary, it is little known how much of that is fact and how much is fiction.
Anjka
Ylona

Erszebet
Yldjko
Clanship
Valkyr Matriarch
Super Valkyr
Valkyr
Probe
Tenekech
Attjla

Tenekech is aware of the fact that he is a direct-line descendent of Anjka, but he doesn't rub it in. Good-humored, loud, and happy, his jolly exterior hides a clever mind and some of the nimblest fingers in the fleet. Like most Vaulters he dreams of a permanent home, and his famous ancestor's renown makes it even more important for him.
Resources should be hoarded, not wasted in war. A Cease Fire seems acceptable.
I think we've made our point, and I don't think war is the way to move ahead. The clans are fine with a Cease Fire.
Things aren't going the way we want them to. Maybe a Cooperation Agreement would help change that.
We have a stable base to work from. Let's try a Cooperation Agreement.
We're moving in the right direction and we could speed that up with a Cooperation Agreement.
I'm going against the opinions of some of the clans when I offer this. Don't make me regret it.
An Alliance isn't like being pregnant. You can always back out if you decide it's a bad idea.
I'm feeling like you're people we can work with. Enough, in fact, to cement this with an Alliance.
This galaxy isn't somewhere we can both live in peace. Let's clean this up the hard way.
Too bad for all of us, but this is how it works out. The clans will close ranks and raise shields.
Things were looking better, but not good enough. If we want this to go our way, it'll take blood and pain.
Hope is running dry, luck is running out. But maybe if you join our Alliance, we can fix that.
There may be some advantages in bringing you into our clans. What do you say?
We have something we can nurture and build on. What do you say you join our Alliance?
There's a shortage of trust between us; this won't last. We're asking you to leave the Alliance.
The future is never sure. But however it goes, we don't see you being part of this Alliance.
Even if things are improving, prospects just don't appear to be that fertile. We want you out of the Alliance.
We've been living without a Peace Treaty for too long. Relations may not be great, but the clans would prefer the stability of a peace.
Could be better, could be worse. Overall, we'd like to formalize this with a Peace Treaty and use our resources more productively.
Everyone gets hungry - or hungrier - in wars and cease fires. We're thinking we can trust you enough to offer a Peace Treaty.
As scarce as trust is these days, we're still ready to propose Open Borders with you.
We'd like to settle down and settle our differences. Are you ready to go ahead and risk Open Borders?
I say we build something together. We're willing to try Open Borders if you'll do the same.
I wouldn't trust you to babysit, but maybe we can still come to a deal that's good for both of us.
We're holding things together with band-aids and baling wire here. Maybe we could help each other out.
There's a lot of risk and instability out there. The clans are willing to offer you this deal and stabilize things a bit.
We don't believe in death before dishonor, but we'll still take it over rash stupidity. The answer is "No".
We've been living in war this long; we're willing to dig in a little longer unless you sweeten the deal.
We have machines to repair and wounds to heal. Your proposal doesn't sound half bad.
We're ready to turn from ruining crops to raising them. I like the way your offer sounds.
The clans would sooner leave a pack of wolves to watch the nursery.
Lots of things are scarce right now, and one of them is trust. Sorry, no deal.
We've been trying to do too many things with too little help. A little cooperation might not be a bad move.
We like where we are; the clans are ready to put down some roots. A Cooperation Agreement sounds just fine.
We'd have to be hungry and terrified to join that Alliance.
We don't have the kind of relations we can build that base on. We're not ready to join you.
We need a little more of everything, and an Alliance might just help us get there.
We're hoping we've found a permanent home for the clans, and we'd be glad to have you as neighbors.
So you say it's time to kill people and break things? Be careful what you ask for.
More blood and destruction, is it? We're not happy, but the clans are ready.
We are surprised that this is how you react to the situation. But we're always prepared for the worst.
War is unfortunate; both on principle and with you. But if it is war you want, you'll find our bunkers are deep and our storehouses full.
We felt the stock of good will running low. This is unfortunate, but hardly shocking.
Too bad. We thought that relations were on an even keel, not a downward spiral.
This is not the best time to go to war with you, but there's no good time for that.
Alliances, like births, are delicate beginnings. But this baby doesn't have a chance.
It's nice to know that an Alliance is in your interest, but it doesn't quite appear to be in ours.
An Alliance is a promising improvement; the history of our clans tells us that mutual support is key to survival.
We won't hide the fact that we are in favor of this Alliance. The clans are ready to work with you.
If you hadn't suggested this, we probably would have done it ourselves.
I suppose that is the way things are headed, though we had hopes for improvement.
We'll survive in spite of this; the clans always do. But to be honest, we're a little surprised.
How can this be possible? We thought you were a serious people.
Our relations were decaying; whatever we had hoped to build was dying anyway.
We thought that relations were balanced; apparently you did not.
This is a serious proposal? It's not good to break and ruin something that's going well.
Our minds are as good as our defenses. You won't dupe the clans into a lopsided peace.
We are not prepared to lower our defenses to you. Not yet.
Peace can bring opportunities that war does not. We are ready for a change.
We like the way you think. The benefits of peace will help us all grow.
The clans rarely let people inside our defenses, and if we did it sure as hell wouldn't be you.
We're not lowering our guard for that. Open Borders requires more trust that you've earned.
We'll agree to Open Borders, though not all of the clans are in favor. We'll see how it goes.
We trust you enough to let you inside our defenses -- I wonder if you understand what that means.
Is this an attempt to show a sense of humor?
We don't see an advantage in this deal, and we don't make deals just for entertainment.
You seem to be reasonable, and this offer seems to make sense. We'll go with it.
We wouldn't be taking the good of our clans seriously if we said "No" to this.

You are in an alliance with this empire, sharing all decisions to declare peace and war on other empires. You can see each others' systems and travel freely within them. Note: An alliance allows use of Vaulter Portals.
This will allow the empire to navigate freely in your territories (requires Peace). Note: This allows use of Vaulter Portals.
This will propose to the contacted empire that you form an alliance together. Note: This allows use of Vaulter Portals.
This will offer the contacted empire to join your alliance. Note: This allows use of Vaulter Portals.
DEFCON INCUBATORS

These are specialized incubators for Vaulter entrepreneurs who want to create defense-oriented technology start-ups. These companies receive privileged access to the latest scientific discoveries in order to create new systems and weapons for military purposes
50% OF ḗ ADDED TO SYSTEM DEFENSE
ADAPTATION CENTERS

While these centers are designed to study new planets and help Vaulter settlers adapt to them, like every Vaulter infrastructure they include defensive turrets, bunkers, and warehouses. The research that goes on within is equally defense-oriented, and helps Vaulter settlers dig in to new planets and convert them into strongly defended bases
+5 ḗ PER PLANET COLONIZED ON SYSTEM
INSURGENCY ACADEMIES

As the Vaulters are a people that have a long history of adapting to survive, a fundamental part of their education includes how to create defensive structures and weapons regardless of the local technology, biology, and geology. Training civilians and warriors to be dangerous with everyday tools improves both defense and everyday scientific knowledge
+1 ḗ PER POP ON SYSTEM
REACTIVE BEACONS

When Vaulters have settled a system, they naturally and automatically think about how to improve its defences. This ring of probes and satellites, communicating and reacting in real time, provides superior information and coordination to Vaulter defensive units
+5% ḗ ON SYSTEM
VAULTER APERTURES
The faction can instantly teleport a Fleet from one system to another system that is under their influence, if both systems have built these portals.
FLEET TELEPORT BETWEEN SYSTEMS WITH PORTALS. ALL MOVEMENT POINTS CONSUMED.
PORTAL CONSTRUCTION ELIMINATES EXPANSION DISAPPROVAL
MUST HAVE 100% CONTROL OF SYSTEM TO BUILD PORTAL
PORTAL PARTICLE SCREENS

Strange things happen to matter and time when they are accelerated and teleported via the Vaulter Aperture portals. By installing screening systems that read the sub-atomic particles generated in portal exchanges, Vaulter scientists learn a great deal about time, the universe, and high-risk mass transit.
TELEPORTATION MOVEMENT COST
USE OF VAULTER PORTALS PERMITTED
VAULTER APERTURE
DAMAGE WHEN FIGHTING ON ALLIED TERRITORY
BONUS FROM CONSTRUCTED APERTURES
LINKS THE PORTALS TO PROVIDE + 1% ḗ PER CONSTRUCTED APERTURE.
ONE-TIME BONUS (NOT AFFECTED BY ADDITIONAL IMPROVEMENTS, NOT CUMULATIVE)
